headline: US futures, Asian shares slip, tracking Wall Street's retreat, while oil falls more than $2
summary: U.S. futures and Asian shares skidded Monday and oil prices fell more than $2 a barrel.  In South Korea, the Kospi tumbled 4.6% to 4,982.54 as worries revived over a potential bubble in the craze for artificial intelligence.  Samsung Electronics gave up 3.5%, while chip maker SK Hynix sank 5.6%.

content.title: US futures, Asian shares slip, tracking Wall Street's retreat, while oil falls more than $2
content.summary: U.S. futures and Asian shares skidded Monday and oil prices fell more than $2 a barrel.  In South Korea, the Kospi tumbled 4.6% to 4,982.54 as worries revived over a potential bubble in the craze for artificial intelligence.  Samsung Electronics gave up 3.5%, while chip maker SK Hynix sank 5.6%.

thumbnail.caption: A currency trader talks on the phone near a screen showing the Korea Composite Stock Price Index (KOSPI), top center, and the foreign exchange rate between U.S. dollar and South Korean won, top center left, at the foreign exchange dealing room of the Hana Bank headquarters in Seoul, South Korea, Friday, Jan. 30, 2026. (AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon)

headline: Chinese EV Makers Hit Speed Bump
summary: Chinese electric-vehicle stocks dropped on Monday after manufacturers reported weak January sales due to waning government support. Market leader BYD said it sold about 210,000 vehicles in the month— down 30% from January last year and missing expectations, according to Citi.

content.title: Chinese EV Makers Hit Speed Bump
content.summary: Chinese electric-vehicle stocks dropped on Monday after manufacturers reported weak January sales due to waning government support. Market leader BYD said it sold about 210,000 vehicles in the month— down 30% from January last year and missing expectations, according to Citi.

headline: The $3 Trillion AI Data Center Build-Out Becomes All-Consuming For Debt Markets
summary: Not even the world’s biggest technology companies—not Amazon.com, not Microsoft or Meta Platforms—are prepared to foot the bill with only their own cash.  The massive equity investments in private companies such as OpenAI and Anthropic don’t come close to this Industrial Revolution-size cost.  “The numbers are like nothing any of us who have been in this business for 25 years have seen,” says Matt McQueen, who oversees global credit, securitized products and municipal banking and markets at Bank of America Corp. “You have to turn over all avenues to make this work.”

content.title: The $3 Trillion AI Data Center Build-Out Becomes All-Consuming For Debt Markets
content.summary: Not even the world’s biggest technology companies—not Amazon.com, not Microsoft or Meta Platforms—are prepared to foot the bill with only their own cash.  The massive equity investments in private companies such as OpenAI and Anthropic don’t come close to this Industrial Revolution-size cost.  “The numbers are like nothing any of us who have been in this business for 25 years have seen,” says Matt McQueen, who oversees global credit, securitized products and municipal banking and markets at Bank of America Corp. “You have to turn over all avenues to make this work.”

headline: Tesla Made A Little-Known Family Insanely Rich With a $2.9B Deal—Then Cybertruck Delays Wiped Out More Than 99.9% of It
summary: One South Korean family saw their fortune swell past $800 million on paper — not from an IPO, not from real estate, not from crypto — but from a battery deal with Tesla. Less than two years later, the value of that contract was quietly revised down to just $7,386. Yes, from $2.9 billion to $7,386. A 99.9997% collapse. Behind the swing is L&F Co., a manufacturer of high-nickel cathode materials used in electric vehicle batteries. In February 2023, the company signed a supply agreement with Tesla

content.title: Tesla Made A Little-Known Family Insanely Rich With a $2.9B Deal—Then Cybertruck Delays Wiped Out More Than 99.9% of It
content.summary: One South Korean family saw their fortune swell past $800 million on paper — not from an IPO, not from real estate, not from crypto — but from a battery deal with Tesla. Less than two years later, the value of that contract was quietly revised down to just $7,386. Yes, from $2.9 billion to $7,386. A 99.9997% collapse. headline: Tesla Stock Falls. Ford Could Help Bring Chinese EVs to America.
summary: Tesla  stock fell early Monday after a report that  Ford Motor  was considering a collaboration with Chinese electric-vehicle makers.  Shares of Elon Musk’s EV company were down 2.2% at $420.95 in premarket trading, while  and  futures were off 0.5% and 0.1%, respectively.  The move came after a Financial Times report that Ford has held discussions with China’s  Xiaomi  and  BYD  to help bring Chinese EVs into America.

content.title: Tesla Stock Falls. Ford Could Help Bring Chinese EVs to America.
content.summary: Tesla  stock fell early Monday after a report that  Ford Motor  was considering a collaboration with Chinese electric-vehicle makers.  Shares of Elon Musk’s EV company were down 2.2% at $420.95 in premarket trading, while  and  futures were off 0.5% and 0.1%, respectively.  The move came after a Financial Times report that Ford has held discussions with China’s  Xiaomi  and  BYD  to help bring Chinese EVs into America.

headline: Retirees and Income Investors Missed QQQM’s 108% Return By Focusing On The Wrong Thing
summary: The Invesco NASDAQ 100 ETF (NASDAQ:QQQM) doesn’t generate income the way traditional dividend ETFs do. With a yield of just 0.51%, this fund tracks growth-focused technology companies that reinvest profits rather than distribute them. The modest distributions come entirely from whatever dividends the underlying holdings choose to pay, which explains why income investors typically look ... Retirees and Income Investors Missed QQQM’s 108% Return By Focusing On The Wrong Thing

headline: Trump lowers India tariffs, BLS Jan. jobs report to be delayed
summary: Yahoo Finance Senior Producer John Hyland tracks Monday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) announced that the January jobs report will be delayed due to the partial government shutdown. The US and India have reached a trade agreement. President Trump said tariffs on Indian goods will be lowered from 25% to 18%. Elon Musk is reportedly in advanced talks to combine SpaceX (SPAX.PVT) with Tesla (TSLA) or xAI (XAAI.PVT), according to Bloomberg. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

content.title: Trump lowers India tariffs, BLS Jan. jobs report to be delayed
content.description:
Yahoo Finance Senior Producer John Hyland tracks Monday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute.

The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) announced that the January jobs report will be delayed due to the partial government shutdown.

The US and India have reached a trade agreement. President Trump said tariffs on Indian goods will be lowered from 25% to 18%.

Elon Musk is reportedly in advanced talks to combine SpaceX (SPAX.PVT) with Tesla (TSLA) or xAI (XAAI.PVT), according to Bloomberg.

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
content.summary: Yahoo Finance Senior Producer John Hyland tracks Monday's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) announced that the January jobs report will be delayed due to the partial government shutdown. The US and India have reached a trade agreement. President Trump said tariffs on Indian goods will be lowered from 25% to 18%. Elon Musk is reportedly in advanced talks to combine SpaceX (SPAX.PVT) with Tesla (TSLA) or xAI (XAAI.PVT), according to Bloomberg. headline: Tesla SpaceX Merger Talks Reframe Investment Case Around Robotics And AI
summary: Reports suggest Tesla and SpaceX are exploring a potential merger, with xAI also mentioned as a possible part of a broader restructuring of Elon Musk's companies. Tesla is reported to be discontinuing production of its Model S and Model X vehicles to free factory capacity for its Optimus humanoid robot and robotaxi operations. These shifts point to a possible reshaping of Tesla from a pure electric vehicle maker toward a wider focus on robotics and AI under Musk's umbrella of...

content.title: Tesla SpaceX Merger Talks Reframe Investment Case Around Robotics And AI
content.summary: Reports suggest Tesla and SpaceX are exploring a potential merger, with xAI also mentioned as a possible part of a broader restructuring of Elon Musk's companies. Tesla is reported to be discontinuing production of its Model S and Model X vehicles to free factory capacity for its Optimus humanoid robot and robotaxi operations. These shifts point to a possible reshaping of Tesla from a pure electric vehicle maker toward a wider focus on robotics and AI under Musk's umbrella of...

headline: Elon Musk Says 'Saving The State' As Delaware Supreme Court Slashes Tesla Legal Fees By Over $100 Million
summary: The Delaware Supreme Court on Friday cut legal fees owed by Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) to $70.9 million from $176.1 million in a shareholder lawsuit over director compensation. The court ruled that a Delaware Chancery Court judge overvalued the settlement when determining attorney fees. Lawyers represented the Detroit firefighter and police pension fund, which sued Tesla directors for excessive self-compensation. Elon Musk responded to the news on X, saying, “Delaware Supreme is saving the state.”

content.title: Elon Musk Says 'Saving The State' As Delaware Supreme Court Slashes Tesla Legal Fees By Over $100 Million
content.summary: The Delaware Supreme Court on Friday cut legal fees owed by Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) to $70.9 million from $176.1 million in a shareholder lawsuit over director compensation. The court ruled that a Delaware Chancery Court judge overvalued the settlement when determining attorney fees. Lawyers represented the Detroit firefighter and police pension fund, which sued Tesla directors for excessive self-compensation. Elon Musk responded to the news on X, saying, “Delaware Supreme is saving the state.”

headline: SpaceX acquires xAI in record-setting deal as Musk looks to unify AI and space ambitions
summary: Elon Musk said on Monday that SpaceX has acquired his artificial-intelligence startup xAI in a record-setting deal that unifies Musk's AI and space ambitions by combining the rocket-and-satellite company ​with the maker of the Grok chatbot.  The deal, first reported by Reuters last week, represents one of the most ‌ambitious tie-ups in the technology sector yet, combining a space-and-defense contractor with a fast-growing AI developer whose costs are largely driven by chips, data centers and energy. ‌It could also bolster SpaceX’s data-center ambitions as Musk competes with rivals like Alphabet's Google, Meta, Amazon-backed Anthropic and OpenAI in the AI sector.  Investors in xAI will receive 0.1433 shares of SpaceX for every share of xAI as part of the acquisition, this person said.

content.title: SpaceX acquires xAI in record-setting deal as Musk looks to unify AI and space ambitions
content.summary: Elon Musk said on Monday that SpaceX has acquired his artificial-intelligence startup xAI in a record-setting deal that unifies Musk's AI and space ambitions by combining the rocket-and-satellite company ​with the maker of the Grok chatbot.  The deal, first reported by Reuters last week, represents one of the most ‌ambitious tie-ups in the technology sector yet, combining a space-and-defense contractor with a fast-growing AI developer whose costs are largely driven by chips, data centers and energy. ‌It could also bolster SpaceX’s data-center ambitions as Musk competes with rivals like Alphabet's Google, Meta, Amazon-backed Anthropic and OpenAI in the AI sector.  Investors in xAI will receive 0.1433 shares of SpaceX for every share of xAI as part of the acquisition, this person said.
